basics.name: Kouyakou-Abalo SIMSOBA
basics.label: Google DeepMind Scholar | AI Researcher
basics.summary: Google DeepMind Scholar specializing in Artificial Intelligence with research interests in robust machine learning, time series forecasting, NLP, and computer vision. Currently pursuing an M.Sc. in Artificial Intelligence for Science at AIMS South Africa.

education.institution: Pan African University Institute for Basic Sciences, Technology and Innovation (PAUSTI)
education.notes: Thesis: A Hybrid Minkowski-Log-Cosh loss function for Robust LSTM-based time series forecasting

work.name: African Institute for Mathematical Sciences (AIMS)
work.summary: Research on robust machine learning and time series forecasting for epidemiological applications.
highlights: Developed a novel hybrid Minkowski-Log-Cosh loss function to enhance LSTM robustness against outliers
Applied deep learning models to 10-year public health dataset (2013-2023) for malaria incidence forecasting
Demonstrated significant improvements in predictive accuracy over traditional loss functions in noisy data

work.name: Université de Kara
work.summary: Research on agricultural yield prediction and educational impact assessment.
highlights: Designed and implemented ANN models for agricultural yield prediction using climate and soil variables
Conducted research evaluating socio-economic impact of online learning during COVID-19 pandemic
Performed comprehensive feature sensitivity analysis to identify key drivers of crop productivity

publications.name: A Hybrid Minkowski-Log-Cosh Loss Function for Robust Long Short-Term Memory-Based Time Series Forecasting
publications.summary: Proposed a novel hybrid loss function combining Minkowski and Log-Cosh metrics for robust time-series forecasting using LSTM networks, with applications to noisy epidemiological data.
